descriptions: Student does not demonstrate an understanding of rotations, reflections, translations, or dilations.
Student can identify some of the transformations (rotations, reflections, translations, or dilations) but struggles to apply them.
Student can identify and apply rotations, reflections, or translations, but not dilations.
Student can identify and apply rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations in simple scenarios.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations, and can apply them to determine similarity.

Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations. Student can clearly explain and apply them in complex scenarios to determine similarity and describe the sequence of transformations.
Student cannot describe any sequence of transformations between two similar figures.
Student attempts to describe a sequence of transformations but the description is unclear or incorrect.
Student can describe a sequence of transformations, but the sequence does not accurately map one figure onto the other.
Student can describe a sequence of transformations that maps one figure onto the other, but the description lacks precision or detail.
Student accurately describes a sequence of transformations that exhibits the similarity between two figures, including the order and type of transformations.

Student precisely and comprehensively describes a sequence of transformations that exhibits the similarity between two figures, including the order, type of transformations, and scale factors (if any). Student explains why this sequence works.
Student does not use appropriate mathematical vocabulary related to transformations and similarity.
Student uses some mathematical vocabulary, but it is often misused or imprecise.
Student uses basic mathematical vocabulary related to transformations and similarity with some accuracy.
Student uses mathematical vocabulary accurately to describe transformations and similarity.
Student consistently uses precise and appropriate mathematical vocabulary to describe transformations and similarity.
Student expertly uses mathematical vocabulary to clearly and effectively communicate about transformations and similarity, demonstrating a deep understanding of the concepts.
